verse.name: v1
verse.lines: I am an old man, a gray-bearded knight But I stood with young Harry on Agincourt's field My arm is still strong and my eye is still bright And Baron or bandit, to no man I'll yield

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: I'll hold the line, when darkness is fallin' I'll hold the line, with courage and steel I'll hold the line, till the gray dawn is breakin' And damned if I ever will yield

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Oh, I hear the whispers of popinjay warriors Unblooded young men and merchant's third sons They call me grandfather and laugh at my warnings But there'll be no laughter when battles begun

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: And now the French army is camped o'er the river And on the morrow they'll be at the walls And all the young popinjays come to me cryin' Oh, what shall we do when the battle is called?

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Oh, I am an old man, a gray-bearded knight But I stood with young Harry on Agincourt's field My arm is still strong and my eye is still bright And baron or bandit, to no man I'll yield
